definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
gear/brake/sluice/lock (on waterway)/electric switch or circuit breaker
old variant of 閘|闸[zha2]/sluice/lock (on waterway)

sentences.english: I do have 3 bikes with handle bar brakes that she can use.
sentences.chinese: 我有三辆车子是带手闸的，下次她可以用这种车子。

sentences.english: The car, whose handbrake wasn't very reliable, began to slide backwards.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车已开始向后滑动，因为手闸不太灵。

definition: to put into gear/to engage the gear/gear change
to brake (when driving)/to stop/to switch off/to check (bad habits)/a brake
see 放空擋|放空挡[fang4 kong1 dang3]
to step on the brake/to brake (when driving)
pedal (in a car, on a piano etc)/treadle/footstool/footrest/footboard
brake lever/crank handle for stopping or turning off machinery
